item.title: Kotlin's pills #1 properties introduction
item.description: Why is kotlin awesome? Because unlike java it doesn’t sucks. For example kotlin have properties: var test = "hello" get(){ return field + " world" } set(value){ field = value } Does this look like the classical Java shit with getters and setters? Yes it does, but… You can use it like this test = "what a shitty" println(test) OUTPUT: what a shitty world This is the most awesome thing ever, as it makes everything more simple, no more:
